member.summary: Simple interface that represent a logger.

member.name: M:WampSharp.Logging.ILog.Log(WampSharp.Logging.LogLevel,System.Func{System.String},System.Exception,System.Object[])
member.summary: Log a message the specified log level.
member.param: Optional format parameters for the message generated by the messagefunc.
member.returns: true if the message was logged. Otherwise false.
member.remarks:
Note to implementers: the message func should not be called if the loglevel is not enabled so as not to incur performance penalties.
To check IsEnabled call Log with only LogLevel and check the return value, no event will be written.

member.name: M:WampSharp.Logging.LogProviders.LogMessageFormatter.SimulateStructuredLogging(System.Func{System.String},System.Object[])
member.summary:
Some logging frameworks support structured logging, such as serilog. This will allow you to add names to structured data in a format string: For example: Log("Log message to {user}", user). This only works with serilog, but as the user of LibLog, you don't know if serilog is actually used. So, this class simulates that. it will replace any text in {curly braces} with an index number.
"Log {message} to {user}" would turn into => "Log {0} to {1}". Then the format parameters are handled using regular .net string.Format.

member.name: M:WampSharp.Core.Cra.WampCraHelpers.DeriveKey(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Computes a derived cryptographic key from a password according to PBKDF2 http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PBKDF2. The function will only return a derived key if at least 'salt' is present in the 'extra' dictionary. The complete set of attributes that can be set in 'extra': salt: The salt value to be used. iterations: Number of iterations of derivation algorithm to run. keylen: Key length to derive.
member.param: The secret key from which to derive.
Extra data for salting the secret. Possible key values 'salt' (required, otherwise returns @secret), 'iterations' (1000 default), and/or 'keylen' (32 default).
member.returns: A derived key (Base64 encoded) if a salt is provided in the extra parameter, or the value of parameter 'secret' if not.

member.name: M:WampSharp.Core.Cra.WampCraHelpers.DeriveKey(System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Computes a derived cryptographic key from a password according to PBKDF2 http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PBKDF2. The function will only return a derived key if at least 'salt' is present in the 'extra' dictionary. The complete set of attributes that can be set in 'extra': salt: The salt value to be used. iterations: Number of iterations of derivation algorithm to run. keylen: Key length to derive.
member.param: The secret key from which to derive.
member.returns: A derived key (Base64 encoded) if a salt is provided in the extra parameter, or the value of parameter 'secret' if not.

member.summary: Compute the authentication signature from an authentication challenge and a secret.

member.name: M:WampSharp.Core.Cra.WampCraHelpers.PBKDF2Sha256GetBytes(System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Implements PBKDF2 functionality by using a pseudorandom number generator based on HMACSHA256.
member.exception: Thrown when one or more arguments are outside the required range.
member.param: The number of pseudo-random key bytes to generate.
The password used to derive the key. After use, the password and salt should be cleared (with Array.Clear)
The key salt used to derive the key. After use, the password and salt should be cleared (with Array.Clear)
The number of iterations for the operation. The iteration count should be as high as possible without causing unreasonable delay.
member.returns: A byte array filled with pseudo-random key bytes.

member.name: T:WampSharp.V2.Core.Contracts.WampErrors
member.summary: Contains predefined WAMP ERROR uris
member.remarks: From https://github.com/tavendo/WAMP/blob/master/spec/basic.md

member.name: F:WampSharp.V2.Core.Contracts.WampErrors.InvalidUri
member.summary: *Peer* provided an incorrect URI for any URI-based attribute of WAMP message, such as realm, topic or procedure

member.name: F:WampSharp.V2.Core.Contracts.WampErrors.InvalidPayload
member.summary: The application payload could not be serialized.

member.name: F:WampSharp.V2.Core.Contracts.WampErrors.CloseNormal
member.summary: Indicates that the close was with a normal reason.

member.name: F:WampSharp.V2.Core.Contracts.WampErrors.NotAuthorized
member.summary: *Peer* is not authorized to access the given resource. This might be triggered by a session trying to join a realm, a publish, subscribe, register or call.

member.name: F:WampSharp.V2.Core.Contracts.WampErrors.AuthorizationFailed
member.summary: A Dealer or Broker could not determine if the *Peer* is authorized to perform a join, call, register, publish or subscribe, since the authorization operation *itself* failed. E.g. a custom authorizer did run into an error.

member.name: F:WampSharp.V2.Core.Contracts.WampErrors.NoSuchRealm
member.summary: *Peer* wanted to join a non-existing realm (and the *Router* did not allow to auto-create the realm).

member.name: F:WampSharp.V2.Core.Contracts.WampErrors.NoSuchRole
member.summary: A *Peer* was to be authenticated under a Role that does not (or no longer) exists on the Router. For example, the *Peer* was successfully authenticated, but the Role configured does not exists - hence there is some misconfiguration in the Router.

member.name: F:WampSharp.V2.Core.Contracts.WampErrors.SystemShutdown
member.summary: The *Peer* is shutting down completely - used as a `GOODBYE` (or `ABORT`) reason.

member.name: F:WampSharp.V2.Core.Contracts.WampErrors.CloseRealm
member.summary: The *Peer* want to leave the realm - used as a `GOODBYE` reason.

member.name: F:WampSharp.V2.Core.Contracts.WampErrors.GoodbyeAndOut
member.summary: A *Peer* acknowledges ending of a session - used as a `GOOBYE` reply reason.

member.name: F:WampSharp.V2.Core.Contracts.WampErrors.NoSuchProcedure
member.summary: A *Dealer* could not perform a call, since the procedure called does not exist.

member.name: F:WampSharp.V2.Core.Contracts.WampErrors.NoSuchSubscription
member.summary: A *Broker* could not perform a unsubscribe, since the given subscription is not active.

member.name: F:WampSharp.V2.Core.Contracts.WampErrors.NoSuchRegistration
member.summary: A *Dealer* could not perform a unregister, since the given registration is not active.

member.name: F:WampSharp.V2.Core.Contracts.WampErrors.NoSuchInvocation
member.summary: A *Dealer* could not perform a cancellation, since the given invocation does not exist.

member.name: F:WampSharp.V2.Core.Contracts.WampErrors.NoSuchSession
member.summary: A router could not perform an operation, since a session ID specified was non-existant.

member.name: F:WampSharp.V2.Core.Contracts.WampErrors.InvalidArgument
member.summary: A call failed, since the given argument types or values are not acceptable to the called procedure.

member.name: F:WampSharp.V2.Core.Contracts.WampErrors.InvalidTopic
member.summary: A publish failed, since the given topic is not acceptable to the *Broker*.

member.name: F:WampSharp.V2.Core.Contracts.WampErrors.ProcedureAlreadyExists
member.summary: A procedure could not be registered, since a procedure with the given URI is already registered (and the *Dealer* is not able to set up a distributed registration).

member.name: F:WampSharp.V2.Core.Contracts.WampErrors.ProcedureExistsInvocationPolicyConflict
member.summary: A procedure could not be registered, since a procedure with the given URI is already registered, and the registration has a conflicting invocation policy.

member.name: F:WampSharp.V2.Core.Contracts.WampErrors.Canceled
member.summary: A Dealer or Callee canceled a call previously issued (WAMP AP).
